casebody.data:
Dittmer et al., Appellants, v. City of Lorain et al., Appellees.

[Cite as Dittmer v. Lorain, 100 Ohio St.3d 76, 2003-Ohio-5061.]

(No. 2003-1118 Submitted August 26, 2003 Decided October 8, 2003.) Phillips & Co., L.P.A., and Gerald W. Phillips, for appellants. Mark R. Provenza, Lorain Law Director, for appellees.

{¶ 1} We allow the discretionary appeal. The judgment of the court of appeals is reversed, and the cause is remanded on the authority of State ex rel. Commt. for the Referendum of Ordinance No. 3844-02 v. Norris, 99 Ohio St.3d 336, 2003-Ohio-3887, 792 N.E.2d 186.

Moyer, C.J., Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor and O’Donnell, JJ., concur. Resnick and F.E. Sweeney, JJ., dissent.
